<a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210156&psource=esamnbwdg0210156&wsource=esamnbwdg0210156" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="The Motley Fool" style="width:100%;max-width: 146px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="146" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8xMi8xNTkzNzAzMTcxLU1vdGxleUZvb2xfTG9nb19PdXRsaW5lV2hpdGUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Almost 15 years to the day after he sent the first tweet, Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey sold it as an NFT (non-fungible token) for $2.9 million on Monday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That led us on a journey to dig up a few notable people’s first tweets.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Oprah: “HI TWITTERS . THANK YOU FOR A WARM WELCOME. FEELING REALLY 21st CENTURY .”</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>50 Cent: “is in Turkey” (think he got confused with Facebook)</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Warren Buffett: </span><span><strong style="color:#000">“</strong></span><span>Warren is in the house.”</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Brew Managing Editor Neal Freyman: “Still would rather rely on my D than onside kick, whose chance of success is much <20% with Gronk ready to receive.”</span></li>
</ul>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/23/us-regulatory-panel-questions-astrazeneca-vaccine-results?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
AstraZeneca Takes One Step Forward, Two Shots Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/23/us-regulatory-panel-questions-astrazeneca-vaccine-results" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of a cracked and leaking glass vial with a red cap and an AstraZeneca label on it in front of a peach background." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDc2L2FzdHJhemVuZWNhLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the wee hours of Tuesday morning, when nothing good ever happens, a panel that oversees US clinical trial safety <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/03/23/980230571/astrazeneca-covid-19-vaccine-trial-data-questioned-by-safety-board?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> AstraZeneca's vaccine results may include "outdated and potentially misleading" data. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The statement arrived hours after the drugmaker announced its two-shot vaccine was 79% effective in US trials. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's the hangup? </strong>AstraZeneca's data cut off after Feb. 17, and the panel says it's seen more recent data that the vaccine is closer to 69%–74% effective. One of its members <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/astrazeneca-oxford-vaccine-concerns/2021/03/23/2f931d34-8bc3-11eb-a33e-da28941cb9ac_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">compared</a> AstraZeneca's announcement to telling your mother that you aced a class when you only got an A on the first quiz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's unclear if the warning will delay AstraZeneca's <a href="https://apnews.com/article/us-data-shows-astrazeneca-vaccine-safe-all-ages-a73e711c7309be4444c65d5f9ae90c43?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plans</a> to file for authorization in the coming weeks. If authorized, it would add another 50 million doses to US vaccination efforts in the first month...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">If officials want them. </strong>The Biden administration says current supplies can vaccinate all adults before June. AstraZeneca's vaccine is less effective than Pfizer's and Moderna's vaccines and (pending further data) potentially also Johnson & Johnson's one-shot option.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Add this to the growing list</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While AstraZeneca's vaccine has been authorized in 70+ countries, the rollout has faced Galaxy Note 7-level challenges. The vaccine’s creators <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/astrazeneca-vaccine-challenges-europe-pandemic/2021/03/21/d8568076-88f0-11eb-8a67-f314e5fcf88d_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">talked a big game</a> even before starting trials, and when those kicked off...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They were temporarily suspended after two subjects developed rare neurological symptoms. No connection to the vaccine was found.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A mistake resulted in some patients </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-vaccine-oxford-exc/exclusive-oxford-kept-covid-19-vaccine-trial-volunteers-in-dark-about-dosing-error-letter-shows-idUSKBN2A1263?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">receiving half-doses</a></span><span>. That trial posted better results, which researchers failed to clearly explain. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Early results also lacked comprehensive data on efficacy for adults 65+.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There were also production issues. Europe, which made AstraZeneca’s offering a pillar of its vaccination strategy, got a third of what it was promised. Over a dozen countries paused AstraZeneca shots after three dozen recipients developed blood clots (but EU regulators said it's safe last week). And South Africa <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-safrica-vaccine/south-africa-sells-astrazeneca-covid-19-vaccines-to-other-african-countries-idUSKBN2BD0K4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is selling</a> its doses after a trial showed AstraZeneca's shots are less effective against the new dominant strain there.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Vaccine hesitancy, in the US and abroad, started out higher than public health officials wanted. Every delay and setback threatens to diminish public confidence further. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/23/citigroup-embraces-flexibility-curb-pandemic-fatigue?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wall Street Explores a New Concept: Taking It Easy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/23/citigroup-embraces-flexibility-curb-pandemic-fatigue?email={{profile.email}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Will Ferrell saying "you need to relax"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Ct2fBe0rc69nq/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='Will Ferrell saying "you need to relax"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Ct2fBe0rc69nq/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, newly minted Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/23/citigroup-ceo-jane-fraser-calls-for-zoom-free-fridays.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sent a memo</a> to her 210,000 employees with a simple message: Chill out a bit, OK? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More specifically, Fraser outlined measures intended to cure remote workplace malaise, aka that drowning sensation after your fifth video call in a day. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Fridays will be "Zoom-free." Staffers are </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-23/citigroup-ceo-bans-zoom-calls-on-friday-encourages-vacations?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banned from scheduling</a></span><span> internal video meetings on weekend eve. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>May 28 (the Friday before Memorial Day) will be a company-wide holiday called "Citi Reset Day." </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fraser also sketched out a more flexible approach to work after the pandemic recedes. Most Citi employees will be allowed to work from home up to two days per week, though some roles will have to be 100% in-person. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Lots of businesses have announced plans to stick with hybrid or WFH arrangements post-Covid...but not many <em>banks</em> have done so; these moves make Citi the first big bank to embrace office flexibility. Fraser's memo also came after Goldman Sachs CEO and WFH critic David Solomon said his company is taking steps to address the mental health of junior bankers following a viral survey that revealed a severe work-life imbalance.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DELIVERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/23/gopuffs-value-jumps-thanks-munchies-lockdown?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
GoPuff or Go Home
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/23/gopuffs-value-jumps-thanks-munchies-lockdown" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="assorted food, beverage, and household items in front of goPuff bag" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDc1L2dvcHVmZi5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gopuff</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Delivery startup goPuff announced Tuesday that it <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/03/23/gopuff-new-funding/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised</a> $1.2 billion in funding at a valuation of $8.9 billion. That's $5 billion more than its previous valuation in October 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the beginning.</strong> GoPuff was launched in 2013 by two Philly college students who, like all of us, were sick of running out of garbage bags at the most inconvenient time. Since then, the company has expanded to more than 650 cities across the US, using delivery drivers who visit micro-fulfillment centers to bring you everything you forgot at the grocery store.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But if goPuff is the Kirsten Dunst of the snack and household item delivery world, cue the Clovers ready to Bring It On: Amazon's 2-hour Fresh service, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Postmates, and Instacart are all trying to grab some of that goPuff market.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Food and grocery delivery seemed to explode during the pandemic, and goPuff reported that its order volume <a href="https://www.bizjournals.com/sanjose/news/2021/01/28/doordash-convenience-store-delivery-trends.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased</a> 400% in the first half of 2020. With fresh funding, goPuff can ride the current wave and keep expanding to new cities and categories for post-pandemic needs.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Who Finds $1,000 In Their Pocket?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210156&psource=esamnbwdg0210156&wsource=esamnbwdg0210156" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTYxNC8xNjE0ODAyNjUxLUZpbmFuY2UtMTc2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You think you’d have noticed a fat stash bulging out of your favorite sleeveless vest. But we’re not here to judge why there’s a bunch of benjamins in your breast pocket. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210156&psource=esamnbwdg0210156&wsource=esamnbwdg0210156" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a>, however, has an idea of what you could do with your newfound windfall. They think <strong style="color:#000">5G could be the next world-changing tech that can potentially give you some nifty returns</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But instead of investing your small fortune in a big behemoth, they’ve found a tiny company that could be poised to make money every time someone, say, buys an iPhone. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All the deets are in their new guide “<a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210156&psource=esamnbwdg0210156&wsource=esamnbwdg0210156" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5G Supercycle: An Investor’s Guide to Apple’s Next Must-Have Device</a>.” Members of Motley Fool Stock Advisor get access to the guide for free, so stash that cash somewhere for a sec and get to <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210156&psource=esamnbwdg0210156&wsource=esamnbwdg0210156" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signin’ up</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210156&psource=esamnbwdg0210156&wsource=esamnbwdg0210156" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Be one of the first to cash in on 5G here</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> "Stock markets in general and our stock price in particular have recently experienced extreme price and volume fluctuations that have often been unrelated or disproportionate to the operating performance of those companies and our company."</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EXPLAINER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/23/qa-bitcoin-store-value?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Q&A: Is Bitcoin Gold? Is Gold Bitcoin? AHHHHH
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/23/qa-bitcoin-store-value" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="bitcoin bull" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzU1L2JpdGNvaW5fYnVsbC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every Wednesday, we answer a reader-submitted question about business and the economy. Want clarification on something you read in the Brew? </em><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Click here and ask</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Ryan from San Diego's question: </strong>Morning Brew just wrote that Fed Chair Jerome Powell said bitcoin is "not really useful as a store of value." So what is a store of value? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Brew's A: </strong>Thanks for the question, Ryan. Let's start with this thought experiment: When you buy a house, are you expecting it to increase in value over time? What about an original Monet? A fine wine? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those assets are considered "stores of value," meaning they preserve their value over time and can be exchanged or retrieved in the future. Cars, which tend to depreciate in value with more use, and cheeseburgers, which tend to get eaten in five minutes, do <em>not </em>store value well.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what about bitcoin?</strong> Jury's out. Bitcoin has been compared to gold, which is known as the ultimate example of a store of value because it's scarce and doesn't break down over time. Some think bitcoin could swipe market share from gold as the "safe-haven" asset of choice for investors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Others, like Jerome Powell, argue bitcoin's volatility—the fact that you can go to sleep with bitcoin at $50k and wake up when it's $65k, or vice versa—means investors will be <em>less</em> likely to employ it as a store of value.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Have another question about business and the economy? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ask here</a>.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Today, We Crown the GPOAT
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Greatest product of all time logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjcwL2dyZWF0ZXN0X3Byb2R1Y3Rfb2ZfYWxsX3RpbWVfbG9nby5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More than two weeks ago, 64 products began their quest to become the Greatest Product of All Time. Now, only two remain: Microsoft Windows and Google Search. Who will win today's matchup? Let's break it down.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Microsoft Windows: </strong>Representing the Unsung Heroes region, Bill Gates's baby is used to being overlooked: The pioneering operating system carries with it over 35 years of computing innovation despite having never been the target of a TMZ piece. But one thing to remember when going up against a product with Vista and Me in its CV? It's got nothing to lose.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Google Search: </strong>It cannot be overstated how important Google Search's legacy is to the question, "Is my __ normal?" Google Search was the top seed from the Simply Make Life Better region and eked out a close victory over the iPhone in the Final Four. There's no way to know for sure, but it may be feeling lucky as it enters the final test.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Head to our <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter account at 9am ET</a> to vote on Google Search vs. Windows.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAstraZeneca Takes One Step Forward, Two Shots Back\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/23/us-regulatory-panel-questions-astrazeneca-vaccine-results\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"An illustration of a cracked and leaking glass vial with a red cap and an AstraZeneca label on it in front of a peach background.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDc2L2FzdHJhemVuZWNhLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the wee hours of Tuesday morning, when nothing good ever happens, a panel that oversees US clinical trial safety \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/03/23/980230571/astrazeneca-covid-19-vaccine-trial-data-questioned-by-safety-board?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e AstraZeneca's vaccine results may include \"outdated and potentially misleading\" data. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe statement arrived hours after the drugmaker announced its two-shot vaccine was 79% effective in US trials. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's the hangup? \u003c/strong\u003eAstraZeneca's data cut off after Feb. 17, and the panel says it's seen more recent data that the vaccine is closer to 69%–74% effective. One of its members \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/astrazeneca-oxford-vaccine-concerns/2021/03/23/2f931d34-8bc3-11eb-a33e-da28941cb9ac_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecompared\u003c/a\u003e AstraZeneca's announcement to telling your mother that you aced a class when you only got an A on the first quiz.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's unclear if the warning will delay AstraZeneca's \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/us-data-shows-astrazeneca-vaccine-safe-all-ages-a73e711c7309be4444c65d5f9ae90c43?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplans\u003c/a\u003e to file for authorization in the coming weeks. If authorized, it would add another 50 million doses to US vaccination efforts in the first month...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIf officials want them. \u003c/strong\u003eThe Biden administration says current supplies can vaccinate all adults before June. AstraZeneca's vaccine is less effective than Pfizer's and Moderna's vaccines and (pending further data) potentially also Johnson \u0026 Johnson's one-shot option.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAdd this to the growing list\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile AstraZeneca's vaccine has been authorized in 70+ countries, the rollout has faced Galaxy Note 7-level challenges. The vaccine’s creators \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/astrazeneca-vaccine-challenges-europe-pandemic/2021/03/21/d8568076-88f0-11eb-8a67-f314e5fcf88d_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etalked a big game\u003c/a\u003e even before starting trials, and when those kicked off...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey were temporarily suspended after two subjects developed rare neurological symptoms. No connection to the vaccine was found.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA mistake resulted in some patients \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-vaccine-oxford-exc/exclusive-oxford-kept-covid-19-vaccine-trial-volunteers-in-dark-about-dosing-error-letter-shows-idUSKBN2A1263?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereceiving half-doses\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. That trial posted better results, which researchers failed to clearly explain. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEarly results also lacked comprehensive data on efficacy for adults 65+.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere were also production issues. Europe, which made AstraZeneca’s offering a pillar of its vaccination strategy, got a third of what it was promised. Over a dozen countries paused AstraZeneca shots after three dozen recipients developed blood clots (but EU regulators said it's safe last week). And South Africa \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-safrica-vaccine/south-africa-sells-astrazeneca-covid-19-vaccines-to-other-african-countries-idUSKBN2BD0K4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis selling\u003c/a\u003e its doses after a trial showed AstraZeneca's shots are less effective against the new dominant strain there.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eVaccine hesitancy, in the US and abroad, started out higher than public health officials wanted. Every delay and setback threatens to diminish public confidence further. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, newly minted Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/23/citigroup-ceo-jane-fraser-calls-for-zoom-free-fridays.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esent a memo\u003c/a\u003e to her 210,000 employees with a simple message: Chill out a bit, OK? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMore specifically, Fraser outlined measures intended to cure remote workplace malaise, aka that drowning sensation after your fifth video call in a day. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFridays will be \"Zoom-free.\" Staffers are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-23/citigroup-ceo-bans-zoom-calls-on-friday-encourages-vacations?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanned from scheduling\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e internal video meetings on weekend eve. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMay 28 (the Friday before Memorial Day) will be a company-wide holiday called \"Citi Reset Day.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFraser also sketched out a more flexible approach to work after the pandemic recedes. Most Citi employees will be allowed to work from home up to two days per week, though some roles will have to be 100% in-person. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Lots of businesses have announced plans to stick with hybrid or WFH arrangements post-Covid...but not many \u003cem\u003ebanks\u003c/em\u003e have done so; these moves make Citi the first big bank to embrace office flexibility. Fraser's memo also came after Goldman Sachs CEO and WFH critic David Solomon said his company is taking steps to address the mental health of junior bankers following a viral survey that revealed a severe work-life imbalance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: That's $5 billion more than its previous valuation in October 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the beginning.\u003c/strong\u003e GoPuff was launched in 2013 by two Philly college students who, like all of us, were sick of running out of garbage bags at the most inconvenient time. Since then, the company has expanded to more than 650 cities across the US, using delivery drivers who visit micro-fulfillment centers to bring you everything you forgot at the grocery store.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut if goPuff is the Kirsten Dunst of the snack and household item delivery world, cue the Clovers ready to Bring It On: Amazon's 2-hour Fresh service, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Postmates, and Instacart are all trying to grab some of that goPuff market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Food and grocery delivery seemed to explode during the pandemic, and goPuff reported that its order volume \u003ca href=\"https://www.bizjournals.com/sanjose/news/2021/01/28/doordash-convenience-store-delivery-trends.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased\u003c/a\u003e 400% in the first half of 2020. Want clarification on something you read in the Brew? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eClick here and ask\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRyan from San Diego's question: \u003c/strong\u003eMorning Brew just wrote that Fed Chair Jerome Powell said bitcoin is \"not really useful as a store of value.\" So what is a store of value? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Brew's A: \u003c/strong\u003eThanks for the question, Ryan. Let's start with this thought experiment: When you buy a house, are you expecting it to increase in value over time? What about an original Monet? A fine wine? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose assets are considered \"stores of value,\" meaning they preserve their value over time and can be exchanged or retrieved in the future. Cars, which tend to depreciate in value with more use, and cheeseburgers, which tend to get eaten in five minutes, do \u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003estore value well.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what about bitcoin?\u003c/strong\u003e Jury's out. Bitcoin has been compared to gold, which is known as the ultimate example of a store of value because it's scarce and doesn't break down over time. Some think bitcoin could swipe market share from gold as the \"safe-haven\" asset of choice for investors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOthers, like Jerome Powell, argue bitcoin's volatility—the fact that you can go to sleep with bitcoin at $50k and wake up when it's $65k, or vice versa—means investors will be \u003cem\u003eless\u003c/em\u003e likely to employ it as a store of value.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp
